Exam


What is this course about?
This course aims to give a broad introduction to central topics in psychology, with a focus on mechanistic explanations of cognition, emotion, and motivation.
What can you expect to learn?
By completing the course you can expect to…
learn about central theories and models in key areas of psychology
become familiarized with common methods used in psychology
learn about examples of applications of psychology to real-world contexts
reflect about the need for pluralistic explanations in psychology
How should you use this website?
This website is designed to help course participants get an overview of the course and the course materials (e.g., slides, recommended readings). Recommended readings cover central topics discussed in each session and, therefore, they represent a central resource for a thorough preparation for the exam. A FAQ forum is available on ADAM.

articles.title: Session 11: What's next?
articles.description: Will we still need cognitive psychology in 2050?
articles.contents:
Contents
Session Slides
Here are a few questions about 2050! What do you think?


Photo by Andy Kelly on UnsplashSession Slides
What’s next?Here are a few questions about 2050! What do you think?
Will we still need pluralistic explanations?
Will our models of intelligence involve g?
Will we think of the mind as a collection of modules?
Will we make a distinction between cognition and emotion?
Will machines have consciousness?
Will behavioral research still be needed?
